papers.title: Revisiting LLMs in Planning from Literature Review: a Semi-Automated Analysis Approach and  Evolving Categories Representing  Shifting Perspectives
papers.tldr: A position paper capturing the category and thematic drifts for LLMs in Planning from the last foundational survey done by Pallagani et al (2024) and providing an automated tool for literature evolution and organization.

papers.title: Rack Position Optimization in Large-Scale Heterogeneous Data Centers
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling

papers.title: A Flow Based Planning Method for Multi-Agent Progression with Deployable Agents and Communication Constraints
Posthoc: The Visualisation Platform for Search
Analyzing Launch Operations using the Spaceport Throughput Analysis Resource (STAR)
papers.tldr: A application that integrates simulation and limited rescheduling, using a constraint programming model to check constraints and reschedule events.

papers.title: DynTaskMAS: A Dynamic Task Graph-driven Framework for Asynchronous and Parallel LLM-based Multi-Agent Systems
keywords: PS: Planning with large language models
papers.tldr: DynTaskMAS introduces a framework that enables asynchronous and parallel operations in LLM-based multi-agent systems through dynamic task graphs, improving efficiency while maintaining coherence in complex tasks.

papers.title: HDDLGym: A Tool for Studying Multi-Agent Hierarchical Problems Defined in HDDL with OpenAI Gym
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: This paper presents the design, implementation, and demonstration of HDDLgym, a Python tool that integrates HDDL and Gym to support research on reinforcement learning in hierarchical planning, with an emphasis on multi-agent environments.

papers.title: A* for Bounding Shortest Paths in the Graphs of Convex Sets
papers.tldr: We present an A*-inspired method to find bounds for the shortest path problem in a graph composed of convex sets. The proposed method outperforms the existing approach, which relies on solving a convex program on the entire graph.

papers.title: Safe Interval Randomized Path Planinng For Manipulators
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: We suggest an efficent combination of safe-interval path planning and rapidly-exploring random trees  for high-dimensional planning.

papers.title: New Exact Methods for Solving Quadratic Traveling Salesman Problem
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling

papers.title: How Good is Perfect? On the Incompleteness of A* for Total-Order HTN Planning
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
PS: Search in planning and scheduling

papers.title: A Formalism for Optimal Search with Dynamic Heuristics
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: Defines a formal framework to reason about the optimality of search using heuristics that are refined as the search progresses.

papers.title: Pseudo-Boolean Proof Logging for Optimal Classical Planning
papers.tldr: We introduce certificates to prove bounded unsolvability of planning tasks based on pseudo-Boolean constraints. As a case study we explain how proof logging is possible in A* with h^max/h^pdb.

papers.title: Delete-Free Planning with Object Creation is Undecidable
papers.tldr: We prove that delete-free planning with object creation as action effect is undecidable. We reduce from the problem of checking whether an atom can be reached by the oblivious chase procedure in a Datalog+- program (a.k.a., TGDs).

papers.title: Cost-Optimal FOND Planning as Bi-Objective Best-First Search
papers.tldr: We define bi-objective FOND Planning and present a heuristic search algorithm to compute Pareto-optimal policies. We instantiate this with policy-cost metrics to compute cost-optimal solutions in FOND.

papers.title: Parallelizing Multi-objective A* Search
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: The paper introduces a novel framework that enables efficient parallelization of Multi-Objective A* search.

papers.title: Partially Observable Monte-Carlo Graph Search
keywords: PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)

papers.title: Howard's Policy Iteration is Subexponential for Deterministic Markov Decision Problems with Rewards of Fixed Bit-size and Arbitrary Discount Factor
keywords: PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: We provide a subexponential upper bound on the running time of Howard's Policy Iteration on deterministic Markov Decision Problems, parameterised by the bit-size of the rewards.

papers.title: Strategies to Improve Goal Selection in Satisficing Oversubscription Planning
papers.tldr: We present two different techniques to improve goal selection in satisficing oversubscription planning. One aims to reduce the number of estimations needed to select the goals. The second one aims to improve the accuracy of those estimations.

papers.title: Going Topological in Multi-risk Extended Markov Ratio Decision Processes
keywords: PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: We provide a new framework and an algorithm that extends single-risk Extended Markov Ratio Decision Processes (EMRDPs) to the multi-risk setting. We show that the algorithm is strongly polynomial under a monotonicity assumption.

papers.title: On Using Lazy Greedy Best-First Search with Subgoaling Relaxation in Numeric Planning Problems
On Generating Robust Plans and Linear Execution Strategies in Planning Against Nature
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: We propose a method that generates linear execution strategies that are guaranteed to achieve the goal despite occurrence exogenous events

papers.title: Automating the Generation of Prompts for LLM-based Action Choice in PDDL Planning
keywords: PS: Planning with large language models

papers.title: On Picking Good Policies: Leveraging Action-Policy Testing in Policy Training
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling

papers.title: Platform-Aware Mission Planning
keywords: PS: Model checking for trust, safety and robustness

papers.title: Potential Heuristics: Weakening Consistency Constraints
papers.tldr: We propose a new type of consistency constraint for inference of potential heuristics that widens the range of possible potential heuristics.

papers.title: Observation Adaptation via Annealed Importance Resampling for Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes
keywords: PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: We propose a novel algorithmic approach for online planning in POMDPs under noisy observations

papers.title: Tight Bounds for Lifted HTN Plan Verification and Bounded Plan Existence
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)

papers.title: Alternation-Based Novelty Search
Landmark Generation in HTN Planning Revisited
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
papers.tldr: The paper presents a new method for generating landmarks in HTN planning using a reformulated AND/OR graph that captures more task hierarchical dependencies among tasks and methods.

papers.title: Continuing the Quest for Polynomial Time Heuristics in PDDL Input Size: Tractable Cases for Lifted $h^{add}$
Hardness of Chosen Length Planning Games and Regular Fixed Methods FOND HTN Planning
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
papers.tldr: We prove EXPSPACE-hardness of a class of FOND HTN problems, solving an open problem from Chen and Bercher (2021).

papers.title: On the Notion of Plan Quality for PDDL+
An Improved Lower Bound on the Length of Locally-Improving Policy Sequences in MDPs with Large Action Sets
keywords: PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: The paper provides an improved lower bound on the number of steps that policy iteration can perform on MDPs with 6 or more actions per state.

papers.title: Agent Planning Programs as Non-deterministic Planning under Fairness
A Sampling Approach to Planning with Infinite Domain Control Variables
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling

papers.title: Initial Condition Retrieving for Hybrid and Numeric Planning Problems
SibylSatOpt: a MaxSAT-based Greedy Optimal Search for TOHTN Planning
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
papers.tldr: A novel MaxSAT-based TOHTN planner that uses greedy best-first search with an admissible heuristic to find optimal solutions.

papers.title: Leveraging Action Relational Structures for Integrated Learning and Planning
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling
PS: Search in planning and scheduling

papers.title: Per-Domain Generalizing Policies: On Validation Instances and Scaling Behavior
papers.tldr: We introduce a dynamic validation method to improve the scaling behavior of GNN-based action policies, enabling them to generalize effectively across larger instances and validating performance across 9 domains

papers.title: Rack Position Optimization in Large-Scale Heterogeneous Data Centers
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling

papers.title: Learning Lifted STRIPS Models from Action Traces alone: A Simple, General, and Scalable Solution
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: We introduce a new method for learning lifted STRIPS models from traces alone, including the predicates, that is simple, general, and scalable

papers.title: Chasing Progress, Not Perfection: Revisiting Strategies for End-to-End LLM Plan Generation
keywords: PS: Planning with large language models
papers.tldr: Our study challenges prevailing views on LLMs' planning abilities. While fine-tuning on planning data alone doesn't yield robust skills, strategies to enhance LLM reasoning indeed made progress towards better plan quality.

papers.title: Automating the Generation of Prompts for LLM-based Action Choice in PDDL Planning
keywords: PS: Planning with large language models

papers.title: Instance-based Approximation Guarantees for Graph-based Nearest Neighbor Search
keywords: PS: Search in planning and scheduling

papers.title: On Picking Good Policies: Leveraging Action-Policy Testing in Policy Training
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling

papers.title: Learning Efficiency Meets Symmetry Breaking
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling

papers.title: On Planning Through LLMs
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: This survey reviews studies on LLMs in automated planning, where LLMs generate plans from a problem and a domain. It covers different models, approaches, and challenges, highlighting trends and key findings in evaluating LLMs planning capabilities.

papers.title: HDDLGym: A Tool for Studying Multi-Agent Hierarchical Problems Defined in HDDL with OpenAI Gym
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
PS: Planning with Markov decision process models (MDPs, POMDPs)
papers.tldr: This paper presents the design, implementation, and demonstration of HDDLgym, a Python tool that integrates HDDL and Gym to support research on reinforcement learning in hierarchical planning, with an emphasis on multi-agent environments.

papers.title: Quality Diversity for Variational Quantum Circuit Optimization
keywords: PS: Local search and evolutionary programming
papers.tldr: We introduce a lightweight circuit representation for optimization of variational quantum circuits using the quality diversity method covariance matrix adaptation.

papers.title: On the Gains from Using Action Observations in Domain Repair
papers.tldr: We extend a domain repair approach to accept action observations (partial or complete plans) as input, and examine their impact on improving the quality of resulting models

papers.title: Is This Plan Necessarily Redundant? On the Computational Complexity of Unobserved Domain Learning
keywords: PS: Learning for planning and scheduling
papers.tldr: We study the computational complexity of domain learning in an unobservable environment assuming plans are non-redundant.

papers.title: Knowledge Engineering for Planning and Scheduling in the LLM Era
HTN Plan Repair Algorithms Compared: Strengths and Weaknesses of Different Methods
keywords: PS: Planning with Hierarchical Task Networks (HTN)
papers.tldr: We compare three recent hierarchical plan-repair algorithms both theoretically and empirically, and show that their differing definitions of plan repair cause differences in the problems they can solve and the repairs they can make.

papers.title: LTLf Adaptive Synthesis for Multi-Tier Goals in Nondeterministic Domains
papers.tldr: We present a technique to solve adaptive synthesis for LTLf multi-tier goals in nondeterministic planning, maximizing the number of objectives to achieve.

papers.title: Initial Condition Retrieving for Hybrid and Numeric Planning Problems
